channel.title: Ars-Technica on nnyhende
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on ghveem.github.io

item.title: Tesla recalls 11,706 vehicles over Full Self-Driving Beta software bug
item.description: The new software bug caused phantom emergency braking events.

item.title: EPA announces rules to slash methane leaks throughout oil and gas supply chain
item.description: Regulations would reduce leaks of the potent greenhouse gas by 75 percent.

item.title: US charging infrastructure is outpacing forecasts, study finds
item.description: The nation is a fifth of the way to its goal of 500,000 chargers by 2030.

item.title: Chromebooks on “massive downturn” from pandemic-fueled heights
item.description: Tablet sales also down, but Apple and Lenovo are holding steady.

item.title: Microsoft Edge for Linux enters stable channel after a year of betas
item.description: Stable Edge release strengthens Microsoft’s latter-day commitment to Linux.

item.title: Android’s November patch leaves behind the Pixel 3, fixes Pixel 6 issues
item.description: The Pixel 3’s three years of support are over, while the Pixel 6 is just beginning.

item.title: Modder pleads guilty to piracy charges, will pay Nintendo $4.5 million
item.description: Gary Bowser admits SX OS devices' “primary design [was] to play pirated ROMs.”

item.title: Instruments on Hubble in safe mode; NASA trying to understand why
item.description: After two spontaneous shutdowns in two days, NASA has kept hardware offline.

item.title: Pixel 6 review: Google Hardware finally lives up to its potential
item.description: Google finally built a great flagship smartphone.

item.title: More than 5 million people have died of COVID-19 worldwide
item.description: Cases are on the decline in the US, but the world is not out of danger.

item.title: Here are the best “early Black Friday” deals we’re seeing right now
item.description: Dealmaster includes new lows on Fire tablets, ANC headphones, 4K TVs, and more.

item.title: Pushing renewable power immediately could save trillions in health costs
item.description: An updated analysis with new health statistics shows the benefits are immediate.

item.title: Apple’s first headset will focus on “high-quality” games, reporter claims
item.description: Also, an analyst says the headset will support Wi-Fi 6E.

item.title: Amazon’s New World faces down a world of wild glitches
item.description: Players spamming the game with giant sausages was the tip of the iceberg.

item.title: Amazon’s satellite launch schedule puts it nearly 4 years behind Starlink
item.description: Amazon says it will test Kuiper broadband satellites in space late next year.

item.title: Why macOS updates might brick your Mac, and what you can do about it
item.description: Anecdotal reports suggest the Monterey update is leaving some Macs unresponsive.

item.title: More than 20,000 people died on US roads in the first half of 2021
item.description: Vehicle miles traveled increased, but not enough to offset the rise in deaths.

item.title: Our fave bounty hunter takes on Tatooine’s underworld in Book of Boba Fett trailer
item.description: “Jabba ruled with fear. I intend to rule with respect.”

item.title: Pixel 6 teardown shows lots of heat dissipation, questionable mmWave layout
item.description: The Pixel 6 has a lot of thermal tape and only one mmWave antenna?

item.title: As teens left Facebook, company planned to lure 6-year-olds, documents show
item.description: Internal posts and job listings show plans were moving forward.
